83.M. Farook Malik: O Muhammad, they ask you about Zul-Qarnain. Say "I will recite to you some of his  story."

84.M. Farook Malik: Indeed We established his power in the land and We gave him all kinds of  ways and means

85.M. Farook Malik: So one time he followed a certain expedition towards the West  and he marched o

86.M. Farook Malik: till he reached the end of the land and the start of an ocean,  where the Sun was setting, he noted that it was setting in a mucky spring and found  by it a people. We said: "O Zul-Qarnain! You have the option to either punish them or  to show them kindness."

87.M. Farook Malik: He said: "Anyone Who will do wrong shall be punished;  then will he return to his Lord and be sternly punished by Him

88.M. Farook Malik: As for him who  believes and does good deeds, he will have a good reward and will be assigned an  easy task by our command."

89.M. Farook Malik: Then he set out on another expedition towards the  East and marched o

90.M. Farook Malik: till he came to the rising of the Sun, he noted it rising on a  people for whom We had not provided any shelter from it (they were so backward  that they did not even know how to make houses or tents for their living)

91.M. Farook Malik: He left  them as they were: We had full knowledge what priority was before him

92.M. Farook Malik: Then he  set out on another expedition and marched o

93.M. Farook Malik: till he reached between two  mountains where he found a people who could hardly understand his language

94.M. Farook Malik: They requested: "O Zul-Qarnain! People of Gog and Magog ravage this land; should  we pay you tribute in order for you to build a wall-barrier between us and them?"

95.M. Farook Malik: Zul-Qarnain said: "That which my Lord has granted me is more than enough, just  help me with worker-force and I will erect a fortified barrier between you and  them

96.M. Farook Malik: Bring me panels of iron." Finally when he had dammed up the space  between the two mountains, he said: "Ply your bellows." They did so until the iron  wall became red hot, then he said: "Bring me some molten brass to pour over it."

97.M. Farook Malik: This became such a barrier that Gog and Magog could not scale it or to dig through  it

98.M. Farook Malik: He said: "This is a blessing from my Lord. But you should know that when the  promise of my Lord shall come to pass, He will level it to the ground, for the promise  of my Lord is ever true."

99.M. Farook Malik: On that Day We shall let the people loose to surge like  waves on one another. The trumpet will be blown and We shall assemble the  mankind all together

100.M. Farook Malik: We shall spread Hell out on display before the  unbelievers

101.M. Farook Malik: who had turned a blind eye to My admonition and a deaf ear to My  warning

102.M. Farook Malik: Do the unbelievers think that they can take my servants as protectors, to save  themselves from Hell, instead of Me? Certainly We have prepared Hell for the  entertainment of such unbelievers

103.M. Farook Malik: O Muhammad tell them: "Should we tell you  the worst kind of losers relating to their deeds

104.M. Farook Malik: Those whose all efforts in this  worldly life had gone astray from the Right Way, but all along they were under the  delusion that they were doing good deeds

105.M. Farook Malik: they are the ones who are  disregarding the revelations of their Lord and the fact that they will meet Him for  accountability of their deeds in the Hereafter, so their deeds will become null and will  not carry any weight on the Day of Judgment

106.M. Farook Malik: Thus the reward of such people  will be Hell; because they had no faith and because they took My revelations and My  Messengers as a joke

107.M. Farook Malik: However, those who believe and do good deeds, they  will be entertained with the Gardens of Paradis

108.M. Farook Malik: to live therein for ever and they  will never desire to go anywhere else

109.M. Farook Malik: O Muhammad tell them: "If the ocean were ink with which to write the words of my  Lord, the ocean would surely be consumed before the words of my Lord are finished,  even if We brought similar quantity of ink to replenish it

110.M. Farook Malik: O Muhammad, tell them: "I am but a human being like you; the revelation is sent to  me to declare that your God is One God; therefore, whoever hopes to meet his Lord,  let him do good deeds and join no other deity in the worship of his Lord."

1.M. Farook Malik: Kaf Ha' Ya' ‘Ayn Suad

2.M. Farook Malik: This is a reminder of blessings that your Lord bestowed on  His servant Zakariya

3.M. Farook Malik: when he invoked his Lord in secret

4.M. Farook Malik: saying: "O Lord!  Surely my bones have weakened and the hair of my head glistens with grey, while I  have never been disappointed in my prayer to You, O Lord

5.M. Farook Malik: Surely, I fear about  my relatives after me, for my wife is barren, grant me a heir by Your grac

6.M. Farook Malik: who  should inherit me and inherit the posterity of Jacob, and make him, O my Lord, a  desirable person!"

7.M. Farook Malik: We answered his prayer saying: "O Zakariya! Surely We give  you the good news of a son, his name shall be John: a name that no one has had  before him."

8.M. Farook Malik: He asked: "O Lord! How shall I have a son when my wife is barren  and I have become impotent from old age?"

9.M. Farook Malik: The answer came: "So shall it be.  Your Lord says: ‘It shall not be a difficult task for Me, just as I created you before,  when you were nothing at all!"

10.M. Farook Malik: Zakariya said "O my Lord! Give me a Sign". He  said: "Your sign is that for three nights you shall not be able to speak to the people  even being sound in health."

11.M. Farook Malik: After this Zakariya came out of the shrine and asked  his people, through sign language, to glorify Allah in the morning and in the  evening

12.M. Farook Malik: To John, when he became old enough, We said: " Hold firmly to the  Book." We granted him wisdom, while he was yet a boy

13.M. Farook Malik: and also granted him  kindness and purity by Our grace, and he grew up a pious man

14.M. Farook Malik: dutiful to his  parents - he was neither arrogant nor disobedient

15.M. Farook Malik: Peace be on him the day he  was born, the day of his death and the Day he will be raised to life again

16.M. Farook Malik: O Muhammad, relate to them the story of Mary in the Book (The Qur'an) when she  withdrew from her family to a place in the East

17.M. Farook Malik: She chose to be secluded from  them. We sent to her Our angel and he appeared before her as a grown man

18.M. Farook Malik: She said: "I seek Rahman’s (Allah’s) protection against you, leave me alone if you  are Godfearing."

19.M. Farook Malik: He said: "Don’t be afraid, I am merely a messenger from your  Lord to tell you about the gift of a holy son."

20.M. Farook Malik: She said: "How shall I bear a son, no  man has ever touched me nor am I unchaste?"

21.M. Farook Malik: The angel replied: "So shall it be  -Your Lord says: `It is easy for Me. We wish to make him a Sign for mankind and a  blessing from Us’ - and this matter has already been decreed."

22.M. Farook Malik: So she conceived  the child and she retired with him to a remote place

23.M. Farook Malik: The pains of childbirth drove  her to the trunk of a palm-tree. She cried in her anguish: "Ah! Would that I had died  before this, and been long forgotten!"

24.M. Farook Malik: An angel from beneath the palm-tree  consoled her, saying: "Do not grieve! Your Lord has provided a brook at your  feet

25.M. Farook Malik: If you shake the trunk of this palm-tree, it will drop fresh ripe dates in your  lap

26.M. Farook Malik: So eat, drink and refresh yourself. If you see anyone, tell him: `I have vowed  a fast to Rahman (Allah), so I will not speak to anyone today’."

27.M. Farook Malik: Carrying the baby, she came back to her people. They said: "O Mary! You have  brought something hard to believe

28.M. Farook Malik: O sister (a woman from the noble family) of  Haroon! Your father was not a bad man nor your mother an unchaste woman."

29.M. Farook Malik: In  response she merely pointed towards the baby. They said: "How can we talk to a  babe in the cradle?"

30.M. Farook Malik: Whereupon the baby spoke out: "I am indeed a servant of  Allah. He has given me the Book and made me a Prophet

31.M. Farook Malik: His blessing is with  me wherever I go. He has commanded me to establish Salah and give Zakah as long  as I shall live

32.M. Farook Malik: He has exhorted me to honor my mother and has not made me  domineering, hard to deal with

33.M. Farook Malik: Peace be upon me the day I was born, the day I  shall die and the Day I shall be raised to life again."

34.M. Farook Malik: Such was Jesus the son of  Mary, and this is the True statement about him concerning which they are in  doubt

35.M. Farook Malik: It is not befitting to the majesty of Allah that He Himself should beget a son! He is far  above this; for when He decrees a matter He need only say: "Be" and it is

36.M. Farook Malik: Jesus  declared, Verily Allah is my Lord and your Lord: therefore serve Him. This is the  Right Way

37.M. Farook Malik: Inspite of this, the sects from among them are divided concerning  Jesus. So woe to the disbelievers who shall be punished after witnessing this Truth  on the Great Day of Judgement

38.M. Farook Malik: They will be able to see and hear very clearly on  that Day when they will appear before Us! But today these wrong doers, neither want  to hear nor see the Truth and, are in manifest error

39.M. Farook Malik: O Muhammad, forewarn  them about the Day of intense regret when this matter will be decided, even though  at present they are paying no heed and do not believe

40.M. Farook Malik: Ultimately, all things will  perish and it is We, Who will inherit the earth and all that is on it, and to Us shall they  return

41.M. Farook Malik: Relate to them the story of Abraham from the Book (The Qur'an), he was a truthful  Prophet

42.M. Farook Malik: Remember when he said to his father: "O my father! Why do you  worship something that can neither hear nor see, nor yet profit you in any way

43.M. Farook Malik: O my father! I have been given some knowledge which has not come to you, so  follow me: I’ll guide you to the Right Way

44.M. Farook Malik: O my father! Do not worship Satan: for  Satan is disobedient to the Compassionate (Allah)

45.M. Farook Malik: O my father! I fear that a  punishment of the Beneficent may afflict you, and you may become a friend of the  Satan."

46.M. Farook Malik: His father replied: "How dare you renounce my gods O Abraham? If you  do not stop this folly, I will indeed stone you to death: so begone from my house this  very moment!"

47.M. Farook Malik: Abraham said: "Peace be upon you: I will pray to my Lord for your  forgiveness, surely He is ever Kind to me

48.M. Farook Malik: I am leaving you and those whom you  invoke besides Allah: I will call upon my Lord and I am sure my prayers to my Lord  will not be ignored."

49.M. Farook Malik: So when he left them and the deities whom they worshipped  besides Allah, We granted him descendants like Isaac and Jacob, and We made  each of them a Prophet

50.M. Farook Malik: We bestowed on them Our Mercy and We granted them  the honor of being mentioned with true high respect

51.M. Farook Malik: Relate to them the story of Moses in the Book; surely he was a chosen man and was  a Messenger, a Prophet

52.M. Farook Malik: We called him from the right side of Mount Tur and  honored him to come closer for exclusive conversation

53.M. Farook Malik: We made his brother  Haroon a Prophet with Our blessing and assigned him as his assistant

54.M. Farook Malik: Also  relate to them the story of Ishmael in the Book; he was a man of his word and was a  Messenger, a Prophet

55.M. Farook Malik: He commanded his people to establish Salah and give  Zakah, and was the one with whom his Lord was well pleased

56.M. Farook Malik: Also relate to  them the story of Idris in the Book; he was a Truthful man, a Prophet

57.M. Farook Malik: whom We  raised to a lofty place

58.M. Farook Malik: These are some of the Prophets on whom Allah bestowed His favors from among the  descendants of Adam and of those whom We carried in the Ark with Noah, and of the  descendants of Abraham and Israel, and of those whom We guided and chose.  Whenever the Revelations of the Compassionate (Allah) were recited to them, they  fell to prostrate and weep

59.M. Farook Malik: But the generations who succeeded them abandoned  the Salah and started following their lusts; so they will soon face the consequences  of their deviation

60.M. Farook Malik: However, those who repent, become believers and do good  deeds, will be admitted to Paradise and will not be wronged in the least

61.M. Farook Malik: They will  be granted the Gardens of Eden which the Merciful has promised to His servants,  even though they have not seen them, and His promise shall be fulfilled

62.M. Farook Malik: There  they will hear no nonsense, but only the words of peace; and they will be provided  their sustenance day and night

63.M. Farook Malik: Such is the Paradise which We shall give as an  inheritance to those of Our Servants who lead a pious life

64.M. Farook Malik: The angel Gabriel who  brought this revelation after a long interval said: "We do not descend from heaven  except by the command of your Lord; to Him belongs whatever is before us and  whatever is behind us and all that lies in between. Your Lord is never forgetful

65.M. Farook Malik: He is the Lord of the heavens and the earth, and of all that lies in between, so  worship Him, be steadfast in His worship. Do you know any other being with the  qualities like Him?"

66.M. Farook Malik: Man says: "What! Once I am dead, shall I be raised to life again?"

67.M. Farook Malik: Does not man  remember that We created him before out of nothing

68.M. Farook Malik: By your Lord, We will call  them to account in the company of all their Satans and set them on their knees  around the Fire of Hell

69.M. Farook Malik: then from every sect We will certainly drag out its stoutest  rebels against the Compassionate (Allah)

70.M. Farook Malik: Certainly We know best who deserves  most to be burned therein

71.M. Farook Malik: There is not a single one of you, who shall not pass  over it, this absolute decree of your Lord is unavoidable

72.M. Farook Malik: then We will deliver  those who were pious and leave the wrongdoers therein humbled on their knees

73.M. Farook Malik: When Our Clear Revelations are recited to them the unbelievers say to the believer:  "Which one, of the two of us, have fine dwelling and better companions?"

74.M. Farook Malik: Don’t  they see, how many generations have We destroyed before them, who were far  greater in riches and in splendor

75.M. Farook Malik: Tell them: "Anyone who has gone astray, the  Compassionate (Allah) prolongs his respite and extends an opportunity until they see  about which they were warned; - be it a worldly scourge or the Hour of Doom - then  they will realize whose is the worst dwelling and whose are the weak  companions

76.M. Farook Malik: In fact, Allah increases in guidance those who seek guidance;  everlasting are only the good deeds, which are the best in the sight of your Lord to  earn you a better reward and yield you the best fruit?"

77.M. Farook Malik: Have you noticed the  words of that person who rejects Our Revelations yet boasts: "I shall always be given  wealth and children."

78.M. Farook Malik: Has he gained knowledge of the Unseen or has he been  awarded a contract by the Compassionate (Allah)

79.M. Farook Malik: By no means! We write down  what he says and We will make his punishment long and terrible

80.M. Farook Malik: We will inherit  all that he boasts of, and he will come back to Us all alone leaving all these things  behind

81.M. Farook Malik: They have taken other deities for worship besides Allah, so that they  should be a source of strength to them

82.M. Farook Malik: By no means! Those very deities will  renounce their worship and turn against them

83.M. Farook Malik: Don’t you see that We have sent down to the unbelievers Satans who incite them  against the Truth

84.M. Farook Malik: Therefore be not in haste against them, their days are  numbered

85.M. Farook Malik: The Day will surely come when We will gather the righteous like  honored guests before the Compassionate (Allah)

86.M. Farook Malik: and drive the criminals to Hell  like thirsty cattle are driven to water

87.M. Farook Malik: None shall have the power to intercede  except the one who may receive the sanction of the Compassionate (Allah)

88.M. Farook Malik: Those who say: "The Compassionate (God) has begotten a son,"

89.M. Farook Malik: certainly  preach such a monstrous falsehood

90.M. Farook Malik: that the very Heavens might crack, the  earth might cleave asunder and the mountains might crumble to piece

91.M. Farook Malik: - at their  ascribing a son to the Compassionate (God)

92.M. Farook Malik: It is not befitting to the  Compassionate (God) that He should beget a son

93.M. Farook Malik: There is none in the heavens  and in the earth but must come to the Compassionate (Allah) in full submission

94.M. Farook Malik: He has a comprehensive knowledge and has kept strict count of all His  creatures

95.M. Farook Malik: and every one of them will come to Him individually on the Day of  Resurrection

96.M. Farook Malik: Surely the Beneficent will bring about love for those who believe  and do good deeds

97.M. Farook Malik: We have made this Qur’an easy in your own language so  that you may give good news to the righteous and warn the headstrong contentious  folk

98.M. Farook Malik: How many generations have We destroyed before them! Can you see any  of them, or hear even a sound of them

1.M. Farook Malik: Tua Ha

2.M. Farook Malik: We have not sent down this Qur’an to put you to trouble

3.M. Farook Malik: but as a  reminder to those who fear Allah

4.M. Farook Malik: This is a revelation from Him Who has created  the earth and the lofty Heavens

5.M. Farook Malik: the Beneficent (Allah) Who is firmly established  on the throne of authority

6.M. Farook Malik: to Him belongs whatever is in the Heavens and in the  earth, and all that lies between them, and all that is beneath the soil

7.M. Farook Malik: The One to  Whom you need not speak aloud; for He knows what is said in secret and what is yet  more hidden

8.M. Farook Malik: He is Allah! There is no deity worthy of worship except Him! To Him  belong the most beautiful Names

9.M. Farook Malik: Have you heard the story of Moses

10.M. Farook Malik: When he saw a fire, he said to his family:  "Wait! I saw a fire. I may be able to bring some fire or find someone beside the fire to  guide us towards the right direction."

11.M. Farook Malik: When he reached there, he was called: "O  Moses

12.M. Farook Malik: In fact, I am your Lord! Take off your shoes, you are in the sacred valley  of Tuwa

13.M. Farook Malik: I have chosen you, so listen to what I am about to reveal

14.M. Farook Malik: It is Me,  Allah; there is none worthy of worship except Me, so worship Me and establish Salah  for My remembrance

15.M. Farook Malik: The final Hour is sure to come, I choose to keep it hidden,  so that every soul may be rewarded according to its efforts

16.M. Farook Malik: Therefore, let not  any, who does not believe in this fact and follow his own desires, turn your away, lest  you should perish."

17.M. Farook Malik: O Moses what is in your right hand

18.M. Farook Malik: Moses replied: "It is my staff; I lean on it, I  beat down fodder with it for my flocks and I have also other uses for it."

19.M. Farook Malik: Allah said  "Toss it down O Moses."

20.M. Farook Malik: So he tossed it down and saw that it became a snake  active in motion

21.M. Farook Malik: Allah said: "Catch it and don’t be afraid, We shall change it to its  original shape

22.M. Farook Malik: Now put your hand under your armpit, it shall become shining  white without hurting you, this will be another Sign

23.M. Farook Malik: These miracles are given to  you, in order to show you some of Our Great Signs

24.M. Farook Malik: Now go to Pharoah  (Pharaoh) for he has indeed transgressed all bounds."

25.M. Farook Malik: Moses prayed: "O Lord! Open my heart

26.M. Farook Malik: ease my tas

27.M. Farook Malik: and remove the  impediment from my speec

28.M. Farook Malik: so that people may understand what I sa

29.M. Farook Malik: and  grant me a minister from my family

30.M. Farook Malik: Haroon my brother

31.M. Farook Malik: Grant me strength  through hi

32.M. Farook Malik: and let him share my task

33.M. Farook Malik: so that we may glorify You  frequentl

34.M. Farook Malik: and mention You often

35.M. Farook Malik: for You are the One Who has always been  watching over us."

36.M. Farook Malik: Allah responded: "Your request is granted, O Moses

37.M. Farook Malik: We  had indeed bestowed a favor on you before

38.M. Farook Malik: when We revealed Our will to your  mother saying

39.M. Farook Malik: 'Put your child into the chest and throw the chest into the river.  The river will cast him on to the bank and he will be picked up by one who is an  enemy to Me and an enemy to him.' I made you an object of love and so arranged  things that you may be brought up under My supervision

40.M. Farook Malik: Recall when your sister  went to them and said: 'May I tell you of the one who can take care of this child?’  Thus did We return you back to your mother to comfort her eyes and that she might  not grieve. Again when you killed a man, We saved you from great distress and We  tested you through various trials. You stayed a number of years with the people of  Median. Now you have come here per Our pre-ordainment, O Moses

41.M. Farook Malik: I have  molded you for My service

42.M. Farook Malik: You and your brother should go with My Signs and  do not neglect to mention Me

43.M. Farook Malik: Go both of you to Pharoah, for he has indeed  transgressed all bounds

44.M. Farook Malik: Speak to him in gentle words; perhaps he may take  heed of the reminder or fear Our punishment."

45.M. Farook Malik: Moses and Haroon said: "Our  Lord! We fear that he may behave towards us unjustly or may cross all bounds."

46.M. Farook Malik: Allah said: "Do not be afraid, I shall be with you both. I hear everything and see  everything

47.M. Farook Malik: So go to him and say 'Surely we both are Messengers of your Lord.  Let the Children of Israel go with us and oppress them no more. We have brought  you a Sign from your Lord; may peace be upon him who follows the guidance

48.M. Farook Malik: Indeed it has been revealed to us that the scourge will fall on those who deny this  fact and turn away’."

49.M. Farook Malik: When Moses and Haroon went to Pharoah and delivered this message , he said:  "Well, who is your Lord O Moses?"

50.M. Farook Malik: Moses replied: "Our Lord is He Who has  given a distinctive form to all creatures and then rightly guided them."

51.M. Farook Malik: Pharoah  asked: "What do you say about the condition of previous generations?"

52.M. Farook Malik: Moses  replied: "That knowledge is with my Lord, duly recorded in a Book. He neither makes  a mistake nor does He forget."

53.M. Farook Malik: He is the One Who has made the earth a cradle  for you, traced the roads on it for you to walk on; and sends down water from the sky  with which We produce pairs of various kinds of vegetatio

54.M. Farook Malik: - eat from these  yourselves and pasture your cattle. Surely there are Signs in it for those who use  their brains

55.M. Farook Malik: We have created you from the earth, into it We shall return you and from it We shall  bring you back to life once again

56.M. Farook Malik: We showed Pharoah all kinds of Our Signs, but  he denied them and gave no heed

57.M. Farook Malik: He said: "Have you come to drive us out of  our land with your magic O Moses

58.M. Farook Malik: Well, we will confront you with magic to  match yours! Let us fix a day when both of us should meet, neither we nor you shall  fail to keep it, in a place where both shall have even chances."

59.M. Farook Malik: Moses replied:  "Let it be the Day of Festival and let the people be assembled before noon."

60.M. Farook Malik: Pharoah then withdrew, concerted his plan and came back

61.M. Farook Malik: Moses addressed  them saying: "Woe to you for this challenge! Do not forge a lie against Allah by  calling it a magic, lest He destroy you by a scourge; for whosoever forges a lie will  indeed be disappointed."

62.M. Farook Malik: Hearing this, they debated their case among  themselves, whispering to one another

63.M. Farook Malik: Finally they said: "These two (Moses and  Haroon) are certainly expert magicians who intend to drive you out from your land  with their magic and to do away with your best traditions

64.M. Farook Malik: Therefore, muster up all  devices and face them with a united front." Finally when the day of confrontation  came, Pharoah said: " Whoever comes out victorious this day shall prevail."

65.M. Farook Malik: The magicians said: "O Moses! Will you throw down first or shall we?"

66.M. Farook Malik: Moses  replied: "Go ahead, throw down first." Suddenly it appeared to Moses as if their cords  and staffs were moving about because of their magic

67.M. Farook Malik: and Moses conceived fear  within himself

68.M. Farook Malik: We said: "Do not be afraid! You will surely come out on top

69.M. Farook Malik: Throw that which is in your right hand. It will swallow up all that they have produced.  What they have produced is nothing but a magician’s trick, and a magician can never  succeed against a miracle no matter how skillful he may be."

70.M. Farook Malik: When the  magicians saw the serpent of Moses swallowing all their display, being professionals  they knew that it was not magic, so the magicians humbled themselves by prostrating  and said: "We believe in the Lord of Haroon and Moses."

71.M. Farook Malik: Pharoah said: "How do  you dare to believe in Him without my permission? This man must be your master,  who taught you witchcraft. Well, I will cut off your hands and feet on alternate sides  and crucify you on trunks of palm-trees; then you will know which one of us can give  a more terrible and more lasting punishment."

72.M. Farook Malik: The magicians replied: "We can  never prefer you, rather we prefer the miracle which we have witnessed and Him  Who has created us. Therefore do whatever you will; you can only punish us in this  worldly life

73.M. Farook Malik: As for us, we have believed in our Lord so that He may forgive us our  sins and the magic you have forced us to practice. Better is the ever lasting reward of  Allah."

74.M. Farook Malik: Surely he who will come to his Lord as a sinner shall be consigned to Hell  - wherein he shall neither die nor live

75.M. Farook Malik: While he who will come to Him as a  believer and has done good deeds shall have the highest rank

76.M. Farook Malik: - Gardens of  Eden, beneath which rivers flow, to live therein forever; such is the reward of those  who purify themselves from evil

77.M. Farook Malik: We sent Our revelation to Moses, saying: "Set forth with my servants at night and  strike a dry path for them through the sea without fear of being overtaken by Pharoah  and without any fear while passing through the sea."

78.M. Farook Malik: Pharoah followed them with  his armies but the waters completely overwhelmed them and covered them up

79.M. Farook Malik: Thus Pharoah misled his people instead of guiding them aright

80.M. Farook Malik: O Children of  Israel! We delivered you from your enemy, We fixed a time to grant you The Torah  on the right side of Mount Tur and We sent down to you Manna (sweet dish) and  Salva (quail meat

81.M. Farook Malik: -saying: "Eat of the good things We have provided for your  sustenance and do not transgress, lest you should incur My wrath, and whoever  incurs My wrath, is surely bound to perish

82.M. Farook Malik: but the one who repents, becomes a  believer, does good deeds and follows the Right Way shall be forgiven."

83.M. Farook Malik: When Moses came to mount Tur, Allah said: "But, why have you come with such a  haste ahead of your people, O Moses?"

84.M. Farook Malik: He replied: "They are close behind me, I  hastened to You O Lord so that You may be pleased."

85.M. Farook Malik: Allah said: "Well, listen!  We tested your people after you and the Samiri (Samaritan) has led them  astray."

86.M. Farook Malik: So Moses returned to his people in a state of anger and sorrow. He said:  "O my people! Did your Lord not make a gracious promise to you? Did my absence  seem too long to you? Or was it to incur the wrath of your Lord that you broke your  promise with me?"

87.M. Farook Malik: They replied: "We broke the promise through no fault of ours.  We were made to carry the burden of the peoples' ornaments and throw them into  the fire, thus Samiri suggested, who threw in somethin

88.M. Farook Malik: and forged a calf in the  shape of a body which produced the mooing sound. Then they cried out: 'This is your  god and the god of Moses, but Moses forgot to mention it to you."

89.M. Farook Malik: What! Could  they not see that it did not respond to them and that it could neither harm them nor  help them

90.M. Farook Malik: Haroon had already told them: "O my people! This is but a test for you; for verily your  Lord is the Rahman (Allah): so follow me and do as I command you."

91.M. Farook Malik: They had  replied: "We will not abandon its worship until Moses’s return."

92.M. Farook Malik: Then Moses  addressed Haroon: " O Haroon! What prevented you from following me, when you  saw them going astray?* Why did you disobey me?"

93.M. Farook Malik: Haroon replied: "O son of  my mother! Do not seize me by my beard nor pull the hair of my head, in fact I was  afraid lest you might say: 'You have caused a division, through civil war, among the  Children of Israel and did not respect what I said, ‘to keep peace’."

94.M. Farook Malik: Then Moses  addressed Samiri: "Now what you have to say about this, O Samiri?"

95.M. Farook Malik: He replied:  "I saw what they did not see, so I took a handful of dust from the footprint of the  Messenger (Angel Gabriel) and threw it into the casting of the calf: thus did my soul  prompt me."

96.M. Farook Malik: Moses cursed him: "Get out of here! Now through out your life, you  will say to other people: 'Touch me not’; and you will not escape your appointed  doom. Behold this god to whom you had become a devoted worshipper: we will burn  it and scatter its ashes into the sea."

97.M. Farook Malik: Then he addressed his people: "O my  people! Your only God is Allah, other than Whom there is no god. His knowledge  encompasses every thing."

98.M. Farook Malik: Then he addressed his people: "O my people! Your only God is Allah, other than Whom there is no god. His knowledge encompasses every thing.

99.M. Farook Malik: Thus do We relate to you, O Muhammad, some information of the past events; and  indeed We have sent you this Reminder (The Qur’an) from Our Own Self

100.M. Farook Malik: Those  who reject it, shall bear a heavy burden on the Day of Resurrection

101.M. Farook Malik: For ever  shall they bear it, and it will be indeed a very evil burden to bear on the Day of  Resurrection

102.M. Farook Malik: The Day, when the Trumpet will be blown and We shall assemble  all the sinners, their eyes will turn blue with terror

103.M. Farook Malik: They shall murmur among  themselves: "You hardly lived ten days on earth."

104.M. Farook Malik: We know fully well what they  will say; the most careful estimator among them will say: "No, you stayed no longer  than a day."

105.M. Farook Malik: They ask you as to what will happen to the mountains. Tell them: "My Lord will crush  and scatter them like a fine dust

106.M. Farook Malik: He will turn the earth into a plain leveled  ground

107.M. Farook Malik: wherein you will not see neither any curve nor crease."

108.M. Farook Malik: - On that  Day the people will follow the call of the Caller, no one will dare show any  crookedness; their voices hushed before the Beneficent (Allah), and you shall hear  nothing but the sound of the marching feet

109.M. Farook Malik: On that Day, no intercession will  avail except the one to whom the Beneficent (Allah) shall grant permission and would  like to give him a hearing

110.M. Farook Malik: He knows what is before them and what is behind  them while they do not encompass any knowledge about Him

111.M. Farook Malik: Their faces shall  be humbled before the Ever-Living, the Ever-existent (Allah). The one who is carrying  the burden of iniquity will be doomed

112.M. Farook Malik: but the one who is a believer and does  good deeds shall fear no tyranny or injustice

113.M. Farook Malik: Thus have we sent down this Qur’an in Arabic and clearly proclaimed in it some of  the warnings so that they may take heed or that it may serve as a reminder to  them

114.M. Farook Malik: High and exalted be Allah, the True King! Do not hasten to recite the  Qur’an before its revelation is completely conveyed to you, and then say: "O Lord!  Increase my knowledge."

115.M. Farook Malik: We had taken a covenant from Adam before, but he  forgot. We did not find in him firm determination

116.M. Farook Malik: When We said to the angels "Prostrate yourselves before Adam," they all prostrated  themselves except Iblees (Satan), who refused

117.M. Farook Malik: Then We said: "O Adam! This  Satan is a real enemy to you and to your wife. Do not let him get you both out of  Paradise and get you in trouble

118.M. Farook Malik: Here in Paradise you shall go neither hungry  nor naked

119.M. Farook Malik: you shall neither suffer from thirst nor from the scorching heat."

120.M. Farook Malik: -But Satan seduced him saying: "O Adam! Should I show you the Tree of Immortality  and an everlasting kingdom?"

121.M. Farook Malik: They both ended up eating the fruit of the  forbidden tree. As a result their private parts became apparent to them and they both  began to cover themselves with the leaves from the Garden. Thus did Adam disobey  His Lord and go astray

122.M. Farook Malik: Later on Adam repented and his Lord chose him,  accepted his repentance and gave him guidance

123.M. Farook Malik: saying: "Get down from here  all of you (Adam, Eve and Iblees); you will remain enemies to one another, whenever  there comes to you guidance from Me and whosoever will follow My guidance will  neither go astray nor get into trouble

124.M. Farook Malik: but the one who will turn away from My  reminder shall live a meager life and We shall raise him back to life as a blind person  on the Day of Resurrection."

125.M. Farook Malik: He will say: "O Lord! Why have you raised me up  blind here, while I was clear-sighted before?"

126.M. Farook Malik: Allah will say: "Just as Our  revelation came to you and you played blind; so are you blind today."

127.M. Farook Malik: Thus do  We reward the one who is a transgressor and does not believe in the revelations of  his Lord. The punishment of the Hereafter is more terrible and more lasting

128.M. Farook Malik: Have these people not learned a lesson, that We have destroyed before them many  generations in whose ruins they walk through? Certainly in these ruins there are  Signs for people of understanding

129.M. Farook Malik: Had it not been already decreed by your Lord and a term for respite been appointed,  they would have been punished

130.M. Farook Malik: Therefore be patient with what they say.  Glorify your Lord with His praise before sunrise and before sunset, glorify Him during  the hours of the night as well as at the ends of the day, so that you may find  satisfaction

131.M. Farook Malik: Do not strain your eyes with envy regarding the worldly benefits We  have bestowed on some among them, for with these We seek to test them, the lawful  provision of your Lord is better and more lasting

132.M. Farook Malik: Enjoin Salah on your people  and be diligent in its observance. We demand nothing of you; instead We provide  you sustenance. Blessed shall be the end of the Righteous

133.M. Farook Malik: They say: "Why does he (Muhammad) not bring us a Sign from His Lord?" Has not a  clear Sign (The Qur’an) come to them containing all the teachings of the former  Scriptures

134.M. Farook Malik: Had We destroyed them as punishment before its revelation, they  would have said: "Our Lord! If only You had sent us a Messenger, we would certainly  have followed Your revelations before being humiliated and disgraced."

135.M. Farook Malik: Say:  "All are waiting: so wait if you will. Very soon you shall find out, who is following the  Right Way and who has been rightly guided."

1.M. Farook Malik: The Day of Accountability for mankind is getting closer and closer, yet they are  heedless and are turning away from the admonition

2.M. Farook Malik: They listen with ridicule to  each fresh warning that comes to them from their Lord and remain engaged in the  sports

3.M. Farook Malik: Their hearts are preoccupied with worldly affairs; these wrongdoers say to  each other in private: "Is this man (Muhammad) not a human being like yourselves?  Would you follow witchcraft with your eyes open?"

4.M. Farook Malik: Tell them: "My Lord has  knowledge of every word which is spoken in the heavens and the earth, and He  hears all and knows all."

5.M. Farook Malik: Rather, some of them say, "this Qur’an is jumble of  dreams!" Others say: "He has made it all up!" And yet others say: "He is a poet!" Let  him bring to us a sign as did the former Messengers."

6.M. Farook Malik: The fact, however, is that  even though We showed Signs to the prior people, not a single nation before them,  which We destroyed, ever believed. Will they believe

7.M. Farook Malik: The Messengers which We  sent before you, O Muhammad, were also human to whom We sent revelation. If  you, O objectors, do not know this, then ask the people of the reminder (Jews and  Christians)

8.M. Farook Malik: We did not give them bodies which could survive without food, nor  were they immortal

9.M. Farook Malik: Then We fulfilled Our promise with them: We saved them and  those whom We pleased, and destroyed the transgressors

10.M. Farook Malik: Now, O People, We  have sent down to you a Book (The Qur’an) which deals with matters concerning  yourselves; why don’t you understand

11.M. Farook Malik: How many nations We have destroyed because of their iniquities and replaced them  by other nations

12.M. Farook Malik: When they felt that Our punishment was coming, they took to  their heels and fled

13.M. Farook Malik: They were told: "Do not run away. Return to your luxuries of  life and to your homes, so that you may be asked questions."

14.M. Farook Malik: They replied: "Woe  to us! Indeed we were wrongdoers."

15.M. Farook Malik: They kept on repeating that statement till  We mowed them down, leaving no spark of life in them

16.M. Farook Malik: Our creation of the heavens and the earth and all that lies between them is not a  game

17.M. Farook Malik: Had We meant to make it a play ground, We would have done it by  Ourself, without giving you discretion to do right and wrong, had We ever done  so

18.M. Farook Malik: Nay! We give falsehood a violent blow with the Truth to knock it out and  behold! Falsehood vanishes away. Woe be to you, for all the false gods you have  invented

19.M. Farook Malik: To Him belongs all that exists in the heavens and in the earth; and the angels, who  are in His very presence, are not too proud to serve Him, nor do they feel wearied of  His service

20.M. Farook Malik: They glorify Him night and day; and do not pause

21.M. Farook Malik: Have the  earthly deities, that they have taken for worship, the power to raise the dead

22.M. Farook Malik: If  there were other gods in the heavens or in the earth besides Allah, both the heavens  and earth would have been in a state of disorder. Glory be to Allah, the Lord of the  Throne, absolutely free is He from the falsehood that they attribute to Him

23.M. Farook Malik: He is  accountable to none about what He does, but they are accountable to Him

24.M. Farook Malik: Even  then, have they taken other deities for worship besides Him? Ask them: "Show us  your proof: here is this reminder (Al-Qur’an) for the people of my time and it also  contains the reminder of those before me." But most of them have no knowledge of  Reality, and that is why they have turned away

25.M. Farook Malik: The fact is that to every Messenger whom We sent before you, We revealed the  same Message: "There is no god but Me, so worship Me Alone."

26.M. Farook Malik: In spite of  receiving that message, they still say: "The Beneficent (Allah) has offspring!" Glory  be to Him! The angels are but His honored servants

27.M. Farook Malik: They do not precede Him in  speaking and they act according to His commandment

28.M. Farook Malik: He knows what is before  them and what is behind them and they do not intercede except for the one whom He  approves, and for fear of Him they tremble

29.M. Farook Malik: If any of them were to say: "I am also  a deity besides Him," We would send him to hell, thus shall We reward the  wrongdoers

30.M. Farook Malik: Have not the unbelievers ever considered that the skies and the earth were once one  mass, then We split them asunder? And We have created every living thing from  water. Will they still not believe

31.M. Farook Malik: And We have planted mountains on earth lest it  should tilt to one side with them (the weight of people) and We left between them  open passages so that they may find the right direction

32.M. Farook Malik: And We have made the  sky a safe canopy: yet they are heedless to these signs

33.M. Farook Malik: He is the One Who has  created the night and the day and the sun and the moon: all (the celestial bodies)  move swiftly in an orbit of their own

34.M. Farook Malik: O Muhammad, We have not granted immortality to any human before you: so if you  are to die, will these unbelievers live forever

35.M. Farook Malik: Every soul is bound to have the  taste of death. We are putting all of you to a test by passing you through bad and  good conditions, and finally you shall return to Us

36.M. Farook Malik: When the unbelievers see you  they do not take you but for one to be scoffed at, saying: "Is this the one who talks  against your gods?" And they themselves deny the mention of the Compassionate  (Allah)

37.M. Farook Malik: Man is a creature of haste (impatience). Soon I will show you My signs,  therefore, you need not be impatient

38.M. Farook Malik: They ask: "When will this promise be  fulfilled if you are telling the truth?"

39.M. Farook Malik: They would not have asked this question if  only the unbelievers knew the Day when they will be able to protect neither their  faces from the fire of hell nor their backs, nor will they be helped

40.M. Farook Malik: Nay, it will  come to them all of a sudden and overpower them so abruptly that they shall neither  be able to avert it nor shall they get any respite

41.M. Farook Malik: As for their scoffing, the  Messengers before you were also scoffed at; but their scoffers were hemmed in by  the very thing at which they used to scoff

42.M. Farook Malik: Ask them, "Who is there to protect you by night and by day from the wrath of the  Compassionate?" Yet they turn away from the admonition of their Lord

43.M. Farook Malik: Do they  have such gods who can defend them against Us? Their gods can neither help  themselves nor can they protect themselves from Us

44.M. Farook Malik: The fact is that We gave  the good things of this life to them and their forefathers until they got used to these  things because of their prolonged lives; can they not see how We gradually reduce  the land which was in their control and curtail it from all sides? Do they still expect to  be victorious against Us

45.M. Farook Malik: Tell them, "I am warning you on the authority of  Revelation," but the deaf choose not to listen the call when they are warned

46.M. Farook Malik: Yet  even if a breath from the Wrath of your Lord was to touch them, they will certainly  say, "Woe to us! No doubt we were wrongdoers."

47.M. Farook Malik: On the Day of Judgement We  shall set up scales of justice so that no one will be dealt with unjustly in any way;  even if someone has an act as small as a grain of a mustard seed, We will bring it to  account, and sufficient are We to settle the accounts

48.M. Farook Malik: Certainly, We granted to Moses and Haroon (Aaron) the Criterion of right and wrong,  a light and a reminder for those righteous peopl

49.M. Farook Malik: who fear their Lord though they  have not seen Him, and dread the Day of Judgment

50.M. Farook Malik: And now We have revealed  this blessed Reminder (The Qur’an). Will you then deny it

51.M. Farook Malik: Even before that We blessed Abraham with rectitude, for We knew him well

52.M. Farook Malik: Remember that occasion when Abraham asked his father and his people, "What are  these images to which you are so devoted?"

53.M. Farook Malik: They replied, "We found our  forefathers worshipping them."

54.M. Farook Malik: He said "Then certainly both you and your  forefathers have been in manifest error."

55.M. Farook Malik: They asked, "Have you brought us the  Truth or are you one of the triflers?"

56.M. Farook Malik: He replied, "Nay! Your Lord is the Lord of the  heavens and the earth. It is He Who has created them; and I am of those who bear  witness to this

57.M. Farook Malik: By Allah! I will certainly plan against your idols when you turn and  go away."

58.M. Farook Malik: So he broke them all in pieces, except the biggest of them, so that  they might turn to it

59.M. Farook Malik: (On their return when they saw the plight of their idols),  some asked, "Who has done this to our gods? He must surely be a wicked  person!"

60.M. Farook Malik: Others replied, "We heard a youth, called Abraham, talking about  them."

61.M. Farook Malik: They said, "Then bring him here before the eyes of the people, so that  they may witness how severely he is punished."

62.M. Farook Malik: When Abraham came, they  asked, "O Abraham, are you the one who has done this to our gods?"

63.M. Farook Malik: He replied,  "Surely someone has done it; the chief of them, that is! Ask them, if they can  speak!"

64.M. Farook Malik: Thereupon they turned to search their own consciences, and said to  themselves, "Surely you yourselves are the wrongdoers!"

65.M. Farook Malik: Confounded as they  were, lowering their heads they said, "You know fully well that they cannot  speak."

66.M. Farook Malik: At this Abraham said, "Do you then worship these deities, instead of  Allah, who can neither benefit nor harm you

67.M. Farook Malik: Shame on you and on those deities  you worship besides Allah! Have you no sense at all?"

68.M. Farook Malik: They cried, "Burn him  alive and avenge your gods, if you want to take any action."

69.M. Farook Malik: When they threw him  in the fire, We commanded, "O fire! Be cool and comfortable for Abraham."

70.M. Farook Malik: They  sought to harm him, but We made them the big losers

71.M. Farook Malik: We delivered him and his  nephew Lot and directed them to the land which We have blessed for all the people  of the world

72.M. Farook Malik: We gave him a son Isaac and then a grandson Jacob; and We made each of them a  righteous man

73.M. Farook Malik: We made them leaders who guided other people by Our  command and We sent them revelations to do good deeds, establish Salah and pay  Zakah. To Us Alone did they serve

74.M. Farook Malik: To Lot We gave wisdom and knowledge, and  We delivered him from the town which practiced abominations - surely its inhabitants  were very wicked transgressor

75.M. Farook Malik: - and We admitted him to Our mercy: for he was  of the righteous people

76.M. Farook Malik: Before them Noah prayed to Us, We accepted his prayer and delivered him and his  family from the great calamity

77.M. Farook Malik: We helped him against those people who had  denied Our revelations; surely they were an evil people, so We drowned them all in  the Great Flood

78.M. Farook Malik: We also bestowed favors upon Davidand Solomon: when the two were judging a  case regarding the field into which the sheep of certain people had strayed by night,  and We were watching them to arrive at judgment

79.M. Farook Malik: at that time We gave Solomon  insight to arrive at the right decision, although We had given wisdom and knowledge  to both of them. We caused the mountains and the birds to celebrate Our praises  with David; it was We Who made this happen

80.M. Farook Malik: We taught him the armor’s craft,  so that they might protect you in your wars: yet are you ever grateful

81.M. Farook Malik: We made  the raging winds subservient to Solomon, pursuing its course by his command to the  land which We had blessed; and We have knowledge of everything

82.M. Farook Malik: And We had  subjected to him many of the Satans who dived for him into the sea and performed  other duties besides this; and We were the One Who had control over them for  him

83.M. Farook Malik: Similarly We blessed Job, when he prayed to his Lord saying, "I am badly afflicted  with disease: but of all those who show mercy You are the most Merciful."

84.M. Farook Malik: We  accepted his prayer and relieved his affliction, and restored not only his family but  also as many more with them as a favor from Us so that it may serve as a reminder  to Our worshippers

85.M. Farook Malik: Likewise, We blessed Isma‘il (Ishmael), Idris and Zul-kifl, for all of them practised  patience

86.M. Farook Malik: We admitted them to Our Mercy, for they were of the righteous  people

87.M. Farook Malik: We blessed Zun-nun (Jonah / Jonah), when he departed in anger,  thinking We would not take him to task for this, but later he prayed to Us from the  depths of darkness, "There is no god but You, glory be to You! Indeed I was the one  who committed wrong."

88.M. Farook Malik: We accepted his prayer and delivered him from distress;  thus do We deliver the believers

89.M. Farook Malik: We also blessed Zakariya, when he prayed to  his Lord, "O my Lord! Do not let me remain childless even though You are the best of  inheritors

90.M. Farook Malik: We accepted his prayer and gave him John, curing his wife for him to  bear a child. They were ever quick in emulating good deeds and called on Us with  hope, fear, and submission

91.M. Farook Malik: And We blessed the woman (Mary), who guarded  her chastity, We breathed into her of Our Spirit and We made her and her son a sign  for the whole world

92.M. Farook Malik: Verily this brotherhood of yours is a single brotherhood and I am your only Lord,  therefore worship Me Alone

93.M. Farook Malik: But the people have divided their religion into sects  between them- to Us they shall all return

94.M. Farook Malik: Whoever shall do good deeds, provided he is a believer, his endeavor will not be  rejected: We are recording it all for him

95.M. Farook Malik: It is not possible that a nation which We  have destroyed may rise again

96.M. Farook Malik: Until, when Gog and Magog will be let loose and  they will swiftly swarm from every height

97.M. Farook Malik: and the time of fulfillment for the True  Promise will draw near, then behold! The eyes of the unbelievers will fixedly stare in  horror: "O woe to us! We were indeed heedless of this warning; nay we were  wrongdoers."

98.M. Farook Malik: Surely you (O pagans) and your deities that you worship besides Allah shall be the  fuel of hell; therein you shall all enter

99.M. Farook Malik: If those deities would have been true gods,  they would not have gotten there; but there they shall abide forever

100.M. Farook Malik: In there,  sobbing will be their lot, and they will not be able to hear anything else

101.M. Farook Malik: Certainly those for whom the good reward from Us has preceded them will be kept  far away from it

102.M. Farook Malik: They shall not hear even its slightest sound, and they shall  dwell forever in the midst of whatever their souls desire

103.M. Farook Malik: The time of Great  Terror (Day of Judgement) will not grieve them, and the angels will receive them with  greetings: "This is your Day that you were promised."

104.M. Farook Malik: On that Day We shall roll  up the heavens like a scroll of writings; just as We originated the first creation, so  shall We produce it again - that is Our promise, and We will fulfill it

105.M. Farook Malik: We wrote  this in The Zaboor (Psalms xxxvii, 29) after the reminder (Torah given to Moses): that  as for the land, My righteous servants shall inherit it."

106.M. Farook Malik: Surely in this is great  news for those people who worship Us

107.M. Farook Malik: O Muhammad, We have not sent you but as a blessing for all the worlds

108.M. Farook Malik: Tell  them: "It has been revealed to me that your God is One God - will you then become  Muslims?"

109.M. Farook Malik: If they give no heed, tell them: "I have warned you all alike in  complete fairness; now I do not know whether what you are threatened with is near  or far

110.M. Farook Malik: It is He Who knows your spoken words and hidden thoughts

111.M. Farook Malik: I do  not know whether this delay is a trial for you or you are being given respite for an  appointed time."

112.M. Farook Malik: Finally the Prophet said: "O Lord! Pass Your Judgment with  fairness. And O People! Our Lord is most Compassionate, Whose help we seek  against the blasphemies you utter."

1.M. Farook Malik: O mankind! Have fear of your Lord; the catastrophic quaking of the Hour of Doom will  be terrible indeed

2.M. Farook Malik: On that Day you shall see that every nursing mother will forget  her nursing-babe and every pregnant female will miscarry, and you will see people as  if they are intoxicated, though they will not be drunk: such will be the horror of Allah’s  chastisement

3.M. Farook Malik: Yet there are some among people, who in their ignorance, argue  about Allah and follow every rebellious devil

4.M. Farook Malik: though they are doomed to seduce  whoever takes them as their friends and lead him to the punishment of burning  fire

5.M. Farook Malik: O mankind! If you doubt that there is life after death remember that We first created  you from dust, then from a sperm, then from a leech- like mass, then from a morsel  of flesh, partly formed and partly unformed, so that We may manifest to you Our  power. We cause to remain in the womb whom We wish for an appointed term, and  then We bring you forth as infants; then We nourish you so that you may reach your  age of full strength. There are some of you who die young and some who live on to  their abject old age when all that they once knew they know no more. You sometimes  see the land dry and barren; but no sooner do We pour down rain upon it then it  begins to stir and swell, putting forth every kind of beautiful growth in pairs

6.M. Farook Malik: This is  because Allah is the Reality: it is He Who gives life to the dead and it is He Who has  power over everything

7.M. Farook Malik: and this is a proof that the Hour of Doom is sure to come there  is no doubt about it; and that Allah will raise up those who are in the graves

8.M. Farook Malik: Yet there are others among people who wrangle about Allah, though they neither  have knowledge nor guidance, nor an enlightening Book

9.M. Farook Malik: twisting things around in  order to lead others astray from the Path of Allah - for such persons there is disgrace  in this life, and on the Day of Judgment we shall make them taste the punishment of  burning fire

10.M. Farook Malik: saying: "This is what you prepared and sent forth with your own  hands." Rest assured that Allah is not unjust to His worshippers

11.M. Farook Malik: There are some people who worship Allah standing on the verge of faith (half faith  and half disbelief). When such a person is blessed with good fortune he is content;  but if he encounters a trial he turns back headlong; thus losing both this world and  the Hereafter, which is a clear-cut loss

12.M. Farook Malik: Then instead of Allah, he starts calling  those deities who can neither harm nor help him; now that is going too far off in  deviation from the Right Way

13.M. Farook Malik: He is calling upon those who are more likely to  harm than help; what an evil master and what an evil friend he chooses for help

14.M. Farook Malik: As for those who believe and do good deeds, Allah will admit them to gardens  beneath which the rivers flow. Surely Allah does what He wants

15.M. Farook Malik: If anyone thinks that Allah will not help His Messenger in this world and in the  Hereafter, let him stretch out a rope to the sky if he can and cut a hole to peep  through and see for himself whether his device can avert that which irritates him

16.M. Farook Malik: Thus have We revealed this The Qur’an in clear verses; and verily Allah gives  guidance to whom He wants

17.M. Farook Malik: Surely as for those who are true believers (the  Muslims), the Jews, the Sabians, the Christians, the Magians and the ones who  commit shirk (polytheists) - Allah will judge between them on the Day of  Resurrection; for Allah is a witness over everything

18.M. Farook Malik: Do you not see how all who  dwell in the heavens and the earth bow down in worship to Allah, including the sun,  the moon, the stars, the mountains, the trees, the animals, and a large number of  people, even a large number of those deserving the punishment. He who is humbled  by Allah has none who can raise him to honor; surely Allah does what He  pleases

19.M. Farook Malik: These are the two adversaries (the believers and disbelievers) who dispute with each  other about their Lord: as for the disbelievers, garments of Fire will be cut out for  them, boiling water will be poured over their heads

20.M. Farook Malik: which will not only melt their  skins but also the inner parts of their bellies

21.M. Farook Malik: and there will be maces of iron to  lash them

22.M. Farook Malik: Whenever, in their anguish, they try to escape therefrom, they will be  forced back therein, and will be told: "Taste the punishment of conflagration!"

23.M. Farook Malik: As for those who have faith and do good deeds, Allah will certainly admit them to  gardens beneath which rivers flow. They shall be decked with pearls and bracelets of  gold, and their garments will be of silk

24.M. Farook Malik: This is because during their life on earth,  they were guided to accept the pure words of Allah and they were shown the Way of  the All-Praiseworthy

25.M. Farook Malik: As for those who are unbelievers and debar others from the  Way of Allah and from the Masjid-al-Haram, to which We have assigned all mankind  with equal rights whether they are natives or foreigners, and whoever intends to  deviate from righteousness to wrongdoing in its vicinity, We will make him taste a  painful punishment

26.M. Farook Malik: Remember! We identified the site of the Sacred House to Abraham, saying, "Worship  none besides Me, sanctify My House for those worshippers who make Tawaf  (walking counterclockwise around it as a part of the Hajj rituals), and stand in prayer,  bow, and prostrate themselves

27.M. Farook Malik: and make a proclamation of Hajj (Pilgrimage) to  mankind: they will come to you on foot and on lean camels from every distant  quarter

28.M. Farook Malik: so that they may witness the benefits which are made available here for  them, and pronounce the name of Allah over the cattle which We have provided as  food for them, on the appointed days, then eat meat themselves and feed the  indigent and needy

29.M. Farook Malik: Then they should accomplish their needful acts of shaving or  cutting their hair and taking a bath, fulfill their vows and go for Tawaf-e-Ziyarah to the  Ancient House

30.M. Farook Malik: This was the object for which the Ka’bah was built, and whoever  honors the sacred rites of Allah, it is good for him in the sight of his Lord. The meat of  cattle is lawful to you, except what has already been mentioned to you; therefore,  shun the abomination of idols and shun all false statements

31.M. Farook Malik: Dedicate yourselves to Allah and do not commit shirk with Him: for anyone who  commits shirk, it is as though he had fallen from the sky; then his body is either  snatched away by birds or carried away by the wind to some far-off place

32.M. Farook Malik: so it is,  and he who respects the Symbols of Allah, surely shows the piety of his heart

33.M. Farook Malik: You may benefit (by using their milk) from the cattle dedicated for sacrifice, until the  time of their slaughter, then their place of sacrifice is near the Ancient House

34.M. Farook Malik: For every nation We prescribed a way of sacrifice so that they may pronounce the  name of Allah over the cattle which He has given them for food, your God is one  God; so submit yourselves to Him as a Muslim, and give good news to the  humble

35.M. Farook Malik: whose hearts tremble at the mention of Allah; who endure adversity with  patience, who establish Salah and spend in charity out of what we have given  them

36.M. Farook Malik: We have included the sacrificial camels among the Symbols of Allah, for  there is much good for you in them. Therefore, pronounce the name of Allah over  them while standing, and when they fall down on their sides after slaughter, then eat  of their meat, feed the contented (poor who do not ask) and the beggars (poor who  ask). Thus We have subjected these animals to you so that you may be grateful

37.M. Farook Malik: It is neither their meat nor their blood that reaches Allah; it is your piety that reaches  Him. Thus, He has subjected these animals to you so that you may glorify Allah for  giving you guidance, and O Prophet, give good news to those who do good to  others

38.M. Farook Malik: Surely Allah wards off evil from those who are true believers: for certainly  Allah does not love anyone who is treacherous, ungrateful

39.M. Farook Malik: Permission to fight back is hereby granted to the believers against whom war is  waged and because they are oppressed; certainly Allah has power to grant them  victor

40.M. Farook Malik: - those who have been unjustly expelled from their homes only because they said, "Our Lord is Allah." Had not Allah repelled some people by the might of others, the monasteries, churches, synagogues, and mosques in which Allah’s praise is daily celebrated.

41.M. Farook Malik: These are the  people who, if We establish them in the land, will establish Salah and pay Zakah,  enjoin justice and forbid evil; the final decision of all affairs is in the hands of  Allah

42.M. Farook Malik: If they deny you O Muhammad, remember that before them the people of Noah, ‘Ad  and Thamud

43.M. Farook Malik: the people of Abraham and Lot

44.M. Farook Malik: as well as the residents of  Madyan had denied their Prophets, likewise Moses was also denied. Initially, I gave  respite to all those unbelievers and then I seized them: see how terrible was My  disapproval

45.M. Farook Malik: How many townships, teaming with wrong doings, have We utterly  destroyed! Today they lie with their roofs fallen in, their wells abandoned, and their  lofty castles deserted

46.M. Farook Malik: Have they not traveled through the land? Have they no hearts to learn wisdom, or  ears to hear the Truth? Certainly it is not their eyes which are blind, but it is the  hearts in their breasts which are blind

47.M. Farook Malik: These people ask you to hasten the  threatened punishment. Well, Allah will never go back on His promise. In fact a day  of your Lord (time period in which Allah's decision is executed) is equal to a thousand  years of your calculation

48.M. Farook Malik: There have been many townships teeming with wrong  doings, to whom at first I gave respite and at the end I smote them. Towards Me is  the destination of all

49.M. Farook Malik: O Muhammad, tell them: "O mankind! I am merely a plain Warner to you

50.M. Farook Malik: Those  who accept the true faith and do good deeds shall be forgiven and provided  honorable sustenance

51.M. Farook Malik: but those who strive against Our revelations, shall be the  inmates of flaming fire."

52.M. Farook Malik: Never have We sent a Messenger or a prophet before you, O Muhammad, with  whose wishes Satan did not tamper; but Allah abrogates the interjections of Satan  and confirms His own revelations, for Allah is All-Knowing, All-Wise

53.M. Farook Malik: He makes  Satan’s interjections a temptation for those whose hearts suffer from the disease of  hypocrisy and whose hearts are hardened - that’s why the wrongdoers are in such an  extreme dissensio

54.M. Farook Malik: - so that those who are endowed with knowledge may realize  that this (Qur’an) is the Truth from your Lord and thus believe in it and humble their  hearts towards Him, and surely Allah will guide the believers to the Straight Way

55.M. Farook Malik: As for the unbelievers, they will never cease to doubt the revelation, until the Hour of  Doom overtakes them suddenly or there comes on them the punishment of the Day  of Disaster

56.M. Farook Malik: On that Day the Kingdom will be that of Allah’s; He will judge  between them; so those who have embraced the true faith and done good deeds  shall enter the gardens of delight

57.M. Farook Malik: but the unbelievers who have denied Our  revelations shall receive a disgraceful punishment

58.M. Farook Malik: As for those who migrated for the sake of Allah and afterwards were killed or died,  Allah will make a generous provision for them; certainly Allah is the One Who is the  best Provider

59.M. Farook Malik: He will admit them to a place with which they shall be well  pleased; for Allah is All-Knowing, Most Lenient

60.M. Farook Malik: Thus shall it be! He that retaliates  equal to the infliction he received and then is wronged again, will most certainly be  helped by Allah; surely Allah is the One Who is All-Forbearing, Most Forgiving

61.M. Farook Malik: That is because it is Allah Who causes the night to pass into the day, and the day  into the night, Allah is indeed All-Hearing, Most Observing

62.M. Farook Malik: That is because Allah  is the One Who is Real; and all those deities besides Him, whom they invoke, are  false; indeed it is Allah Who is the Supreme, the Great

63.M. Farook Malik: Do you not see that Allah  sends down water from the sky so the land becomes green? Surely Allah is the  Benignant, Aware

64.M. Farook Malik: To Him belongs all that is in the heavens and the earth; surely  Allah is the One Who is the Self-sufficient, the Praiseworthy

65.M. Farook Malik: Do you not see that Allah has subdued to you all that is in the earth and the ships  that sail through the sea by His command? He is withholding the sky in a way that it  cannot fall down on the earth without His permission; surely Allah is very kind and  merciful to mankind

66.M. Farook Malik: He is the One Who has given you life, will cause you to die  and then will bring you back to life again - yet man is indeed very ungrateful

67.M. Farook Malik: To  every nation We have prescribed the rites of worship which they observe, therefore,  let them not dispute with you concerning this matter - keep calling them to the Way of  your Lord; for most surely you are rightly guided

68.M. Farook Malik: If they argue with you, say: "Allah knows best all that you do."

69.M. Farook Malik: Allah will judge  between you on the Day of Resurrection concerning the matters in which you  differ

70.M. Farook Malik: Do you not know that Allah is aware of all that is in heaven and the earth?  Certainly all of this is recorded in a Book and it is very easy for Allah to do so

71.M. Farook Malik: Yet  they worship besides Allah those deities for which He has revealed no sanction, nor  they themselves have any knowledge about them; certainly the wrongdoers shall  have no helper

72.M. Farook Malik: When Our revelations are recited to them with all their clarity,  you can notice a denial on the faces of the unbelievers. They can barely restrain  themselves from assaulting those who recite Our revelations. Say to them: "Shall I  tell you something which is far worse than that? It is the fire of hell, which Allah has  promised to those who reject the truth; what an evil abode it will be!"

73.M. Farook Malik: O mankind! Here is an example for your understanding, so listen to it carefully. Those  deities whom you call besides Allah, cannot create a single fly, even if they all  combined their forces, rather, if a fly snatches away anything from them they cannot  even get it back; how feebleminded are the suppliants and how powerless are those  whom they supplicate

74.M. Farook Malik: They do not render to Allah the homage due to Him; in  fact, Allah is the One Who is All-Powerful, All-Mighty

75.M. Farook Malik: Allah chooses His messengers from among the angels and from among the human  beings, for surely Allah is All-Hearing, All-Seeing

76.M. Farook Malik: He knows what is before them  and what is behind them, and to Allah shall all matters return for decision

77.M. Farook Malik: O  believers! Bow down, prostrate yourselves, worship your Lord and do good deeds so  that you may attain salvation

78.M. Farook Malik: Strive in the Way of Allah as you ought to strive  with sincerity and discipline; He has chosen you and has not laid upon you any  hardship in the observance of your faith - the faith of your father Abraham. He named  you Muslims before in prior scriptures and in this (The Qur’an), so that His  Messenger may testify against you and you yourselves may testify against rest of the  mankind. Therefore, establish Salah, pay Zakah and hold fast to Allah, Who is your  Protector - so what an excellent Protector and what a splendid Supporter

1.M. Farook Malik: Indeed successful are those believer

2.M. Farook Malik: who are humble in their Salah (prayers)

3.M. Farook Malik: who avoid vain talk

4.M. Farook Malik: who are punctual in the payment of Zakah (charity)

5.M. Farook Malik: who  guard their private part

6.M. Farook Malik: except with their spouses or those who are legally in their  possession, for in that case they shall not be blame

7.M. Farook Malik: - however those who seek to  go beyond that in lust are the ones who shall be the transgressor

8.M. Farook Malik: - who are true  to their trust and covenants

9.M. Farook Malik: and who are diligent about their Salah (prayers)

10.M. Farook Malik: These are the heir

11.M. Farook Malik: who will inherit paradise; and live therein forever

12.M. Farook Malik: Indeed We have created man from an essence of clay

13.M. Farook Malik: then placed him as a  drop of semen in a firm resting place

14.M. Farook Malik: then changed the semen into a leechlike  mass, then leechlike mass into a fetus lump, then fetus lump into bones, then clothed  the bones with flesh, and then We brought him forth as quite a different creature from  the embryo - so blessed is Allah, the best of all creators

15.M. Farook Malik: Then after living for a  while you shall all die

16.M. Farook Malik: then most surely you shall be raised to life again on the  Day of Resurrection

17.M. Farook Malik: We have made seven avenues (heavens) above you; and We are never unmindful of  Our creation

18.M. Farook Malik: We send down water from the sky according to a due measure,  then We cause it to settle in the soil - you should know that if We please, We can  certainly take it awa

19.M. Farook Malik: - then with it We cause to grow gardens of palm trees and  grapes for you; yielding abundant fruit for you to eat

20.M. Farook Malik: and also a tree which grows  on Mount Sinai which produces oil and relish as a food for those who like to eat  it

21.M. Farook Malik: In cattle, too, there is a lesson for you: from within their bodies We produce  milk for you to drink, besides this you gain numerous other benefits; some of them  you eat

22.M. Farook Malik: yet on others as well as on ships you ride

23.M. Farook Malik: We sent Noah to his people. He said, "O my people! Worship Allah, you have no  other god but Him, are you not afraid of Him for committing shirk?"

24.M. Farook Malik: The chiefs of  the unbelievers among his people said, "Noah is but a human like you, he desires to  assert his superiority over you. If Allah wanted to send Messengers, He could have  sent down angels, we have never heard such a thing as he says from our  forefathers."

25.M. Farook Malik: Some of them said: "He is just a madman, so bear with him for a  while."

26.M. Farook Malik: Noah said, "O my Lord! Help me against their calling me a liar."

27.M. Farook Malik: So  We revealed Our will to him, saying: "Build an ark under our supervision according to  Our instructions; and when Our judgement comes to pass and water wells out from  'At-Tannur', take aboard a pair (a male and a female) from every species and take  your family, except those of them against whom the judgement has already been  passed; and do not plead with Me in favor of the wrongdoers, for they are doomed to  be drowned in the flood

28.M. Farook Malik: Then when you have embarked on the ark with your  companions, say: "Praise be to Allah Who has delivered us from the nation of  wrongdoers,"

29.M. Farook Malik: and pray, "O my Lord! Bless my landing from this Ark, for You are  the best to make my landing safe."

30.M. Farook Malik: There are many lessons in this story, and  surely We do test people

31.M. Farook Malik: Then We raised after them a new generation (the people of ‘Ad)

32.M. Farook Malik: and sent to  them a Messenger (Hud) from among themselves, who said to them: "Worship Allah!  You have no other god except Him. Will you not fear Him for committing shirk?"

33.M. Farook Malik: But the chiefs of his people - who disbelieved the message and denied the life in the  hereafter, - on whom We had bestowed affluence in this worldly life, said: "This  person is but a human like you; he eats of what you eat and drinks of what you  drink

34.M. Farook Malik: If you obey a human like yourselves, you shall indeed be lost

35.M. Farook Malik: What!  Does he claim that when you are dead and turned into dust and bones, you will be  brought to life out of your graves

36.M. Farook Malik: Impossible! Just impossible is that with which  you are being threatened with

37.M. Farook Malik: There is no other life but our life of this world: we  live here and die here, and shall never be raised to life again

38.M. Farook Malik: This man is but an  impostor, forging a lie against Allah, and we are not going to believe him."

39.M. Farook Malik: At this  the Messenger prayed: "O my Lord! Help me against their calling me a liar."

40.M. Farook Malik: Allah  responded: "After a short time they will surely be sorry."

41.M. Farook Malik: So the Blast overtook  them in all justice and We swept them away like the rubbish of dead leaves - so gone  is the nation of wrongdoers

42.M. Farook Malik: After them We raised other generation

43.M. Farook Malik: - no  people can hasten their term nor can they postpone i

44.M. Farook Malik: - and sent forth Our  Messengers one after another: every time a Messenger came to his people, they  disbelieved him, so We punished them one by one and made them a history; so gone  is the nation of disbelievers

45.M. Farook Malik: Then We sent Moses and his brother Haroon (Aaron) with Our signs and clear  authority

46.M. Farook Malik: to Pharoah (Pharaoh) and his chiefs: but they received them with  arrogance for they were very haughty people

47.M. Farook Malik: They said: "What! Should we  believe in two human beings like ourselves, and whose people are our slaves?"

48.M. Farook Malik: So they disbelieved both of them and became among those who were destroyed

49.M. Farook Malik: And We gave Moses the Book, so that his people might be rightly guided

50.M. Farook Malik: And  We made the son of Mary (Jesus) and his mother a sign for mankind, and gave them  a shelter on a peaceful lofty ground, furnished with a fresh spring

51.M. Farook Malik: O Messengers! Eat of pure things and do good deeds, certainly I have knowledge of  all your actions

52.M. Farook Malik: In fact, your religion is one religion, and I am your only Lord: so  fear Me Alone

53.M. Farook Malik: Yet people have divided themselves into factions and each  faction rejoices in its own doctrine

54.M. Farook Malik: - well! Leave them in their heedlessness for  an appointed time

55.M. Farook Malik: Do they think that, in giving them wealth and children

56.M. Farook Malik: We  are eager for their welfare? By no means! They do not understand the reality of the  matter

57.M. Farook Malik: Surely those who live cautiously for fear of their Lord

58.M. Farook Malik: who believe in  the revelations of their Lord

59.M. Farook Malik: who do not commit shirk with their Lord

60.M. Farook Malik: who  give to charity whatever they can give, and their hearts are full of fear by the very  idea that they shall have to return to their Lord

61.M. Farook Malik: it is they who rush in doing good  deeds and try to be the first in attaining them

62.M. Farook Malik: We charge no soul with more than it can bear; We have a Book of record which shall  clearly tell the truth, and they shall not be treated unjustly

63.M. Farook Malik: But their hearts are  blind to all this; and their deeds are also different from the believers. They will  continue doing their misdeed

64.M. Farook Malik: until when We seize those of them who live in  comfort with punishment; lo! Then they start crying for help in supplication

65.M. Farook Malik: We  shall say: "Do not cry for help this Day, for surely from Us you shall receive no  help

66.M. Farook Malik: My revelations were recited to you, but you used to turn back on your  heel

67.M. Farook Malik: in arrogance, talking nonsense about The Qur’an like one telling fables by  night

68.M. Farook Malik: Do they not ponder over the Word of Allah or has anything new come to  them which did not come to their forefathers

69.M. Farook Malik: Or is it because they do not  recognize their Messenger, who is a member of their own community, that they deny  him

70.M. Farook Malik: Or are they really convinced that he is a madman? Nay! In fact he has  brought them the Truth and most of them dislike the Truth

71.M. Farook Malik: - Had the Truth  followed their appetites, the heavens, the earth and everything therein would have  been disrupted. Nay! We have given them their reminder, but they are heedless to  their reminder

72.M. Farook Malik: Or is it that you are asking them for some recompense? But the  recompense of your Lord is the best, for He is the best provider of sustenance

73.M. Farook Malik: As a matter of fact, you (O Muhammad) are calling them to the Straight Way

74.M. Farook Malik: and  surely those who do not believe in the hereafter will ever stray from the Straight  Way
